page.title: 03THE OLD RAILWAY LINES
page.content: The old railway lines,or "LINES" as it is known to the locals was first opened on 24.7.1870.Most of the trains were owned by the North Staffs Railway Co.In its day the railway was busy carrying coal and iron stone from local mines and passengers into Newcastle-u-Lyme. In the early 1900's Silverdale Iron Works closed and in the 1930's the iron works at Apedale closed losing a lot of business.Passenger traffic also dropped and the double line was reduced to a single in 1934/5.More local collieries closed and forced the line to close in January 1963. The lines today have been converted into a walkway streching from Halmerend opposite the school,to Bignall End. The track is made of red ash and the old railway embankments are covered in wild flowers,brambles,bushes and small trees or just grass.
